title: Are there any evidence supporting effects of 'Isochronic tones' and 'Binaural beats'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, there’s quite a lot of evidence. Now, having said that, when you say “supporting effects”, you don’t say what effects specifically interest you. There are spurious claims out there for various products, which remind us “caveat emptor” (“let the buyer beware”). Just because the frequency following response has been known for a long time, you should not simply accept any wild claims that anybody cares to make about these sound technologies, without any direct experience of your own. If you are able to get the effects you want from these methodologies, great! If not… some people do not respond to them as well as others. Just because it works for someone else does not constitute absolute proof that you’ll get the same benefits.
